required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endocuff With or Without AI-assisted Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Endocuff With or Without Artificial Intelligence-assisted Colonoscopy in Reducing Missed Colorectal Adenoma: A Randomized Tandem Colonoscopy Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Colonoscopy is considered the gold standard for diagnosis of colonic polyps. However, it was reported that colonoscopy could still miss colonic polyps. Many attempts have been made to improve the detection rate of colonoscopy. Artificial intelligence (AI) is a promising new technique in reduction of missing rate of colonic adenoma. However, it remains uncertain whether combination of Endocuff and AI can further reduce the missing rate. This randomized controlled trial is to compare Endocuff with AI, AI and conventional colonoscopy on adenoma miss rate.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective randomised tandem colonoscopy trial comparing three different modes of colonoscopy techniques. Three groups will use different modes for first colonoscopy and follow by high-definition white light colonoscopy on second examination. The first group will use Endocuff (Olympus, Hong Kong) and AI assisted colonoscopy for first colonoscopy. The second group will use AI assisted colonoscopy alone for first examination whereas the third group will use high-definition white light colonoscopy for first examination. Second tandem examination of all three groups will be performed under high-definition white light colonoscopy without AI or Endocuff-assistance.
Eligible patients will be randomly allocated in a 1:1:1 ratio to three groups. Patients will be stratified according to indications of colonoscopy (symptomatic vs screening/surveillance).
All examination will be performed with high-definition endoscopes (EVIS-EXERA 290 video system, Olympus Optical, Tokyo, Japan) under white light by experienced endoscopists. All endoscopists should have received training on the interpretation of real-time AI detection system as well as the Endocuff before performing study colonoscopy.
In all colonoscopy examination, colonoscope will be first advanced to the cecum as confirmed by identification of the appendiceal orifice and ileocecal valve or by intubation of the ileum. After cecal intubation is performed, the colonoscopy is first withdrawn according to the group assigned. For group 1, the first withdrawal would be done with Endocuff and AI assistance. For group 2, the first withdrawal would be done under AI assistance only. For group 3, the first withdrawal would be done under standard high definition colonoscopy only.
All detected polyps will be removed during the first examination. The size (measured with biopsy forceps), location and morphology of each polyp will be recorded by an independent observer. The withdrawal time of the first pass to the rectum (minus the polypectomy site) will be measured by a stopwatch and with a minimum of 6 minutes. The bowel preparation quality will be graded according to the Boston Bowel Preparation Scale.
Immediately after the first pass examination, the colonoscopy will be reintroduced to the cecum and withdrawn with standard high definition colonoscopy. A second examination of the colon will be performed by the same colonoscopy. Any polyp detected on second pass examination will also be removed and the withdrawal time will also be documented.

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with missed adenomas detected in the second examination

secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with at least one adenomas during the first examination.
the proportion of patients with at least one polyps during the first examination.
The proportion of patients with missed polyp detected in the second examination
The proportion of patients with at least one sessile serrated adenomas during the first examination.
The proportion of patients with at least one sessile serrated polyps during the first examination.
The proportion of patients with at least one advanced adenomas during the first examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of polyp per patient during first and second pass examination
secondary_outcome.description: The mean number of polyp per patient during first and second pass examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of adenoma per patient during first and second pass examination
secondary_outcome.description: The mean number of adenoma per patient during first and second pass examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of polyp or adenoma per patient.
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of polyp or adenoma per patient.

arm_group.description: Endocuff (Olympus, Hong Kong) and AI assisted colonoscopy will be used first colonoscopy.
AI assisted colonoscopy will be used first colonoscopy.
Conventional colonoscopy will be used without AI or Endocuff.

intervention.description: Use of endocuff with computer assisted polyp detection
Use of computer assisted polyp detection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients, aged 40 or above, undergoing outpatient colonoscopy in the Queen Mary Hospital in Hong Kong will be recruited.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be excluded if they have history of inflammatory bowel disease, colorectal cancer, previous bowel resection, Peutz-Jeghers syndrome, familial adenomatous polyposis or other polyposis syndromes, bleeding tendency or severe comorbid illnesses for which polypectomy is considered unsafe. Moreover, after randomization, if the cecum could not be intubated for various reasons or Boston Bowel Preparation Scale (BBPS) score is <2, these patients will be excluded
